It will not my friend. You lack a sound understanding of the business aspects of mining. Jihan Wu has mined fully half of all Bitcoins. He has never sold a single coin. Work the math and see where the power is.
We are one of the world's largest miners. You dint get Bitcoins. You get stock in the mining company.

Totally incorrect. If Bitcoin goes down you lose. We dont. When Bitcoin drops so does the difficulty rate - we mine mire couns for the same fixed cost. We maje exactly the same outrageous profit whether it goes up or down.

Unclear. The asset would have to appreciate. Mgti makes the same enormous amount of money whether Bitcoin goes up or down. If it goes down, so do difficulty rates and we mine more coins. If difficulty goes up we mine fewer coins but make virtually the same profit.

Any service where you send your crypto assets to them and you no longer control the private keys to your assets. Common example would be exchanges or custodial wallets like Coinbase.
If you don't have the cryptographic keys to spend the crypto assets whenever you want, you're using a custodial service.https://coinsutra.com/bitcoin-wallet/
Reason #472 to avoid custodial crypto services: you leave some assets with a custodian, they insanely increase in value, then you try to withdraw them only to run into withdrawal limits.
